results.definition: drive something violently into a location
a conspicuous success
a gentle blow
a score in tenpins: knocking down all ten with the first ball
examples: he finished with three strikes in the tenth frame

results.definition: make a strategic, offensive, assault against an enemy, opponent, or a target
examples: We must strike the enemy's oil fields

results.definition: affect or afflict suddenly, usually adversely
touch or seem as if touching visually or audibly
find unexpectedly
remove by erasing or crossing out or as if by drawing a line
examples: Please strike this remark from the record

results.definition: cause to experience suddenly
have an emotional or cognitive impact upon
form by stamping, punching, or printing
smooth with a strickle
a group's refusal to work in protest against low pay or bad work conditions
examples: the strike lasted more than a month before it was settled

results.definition: stop work in order to press demands
produce by manipulating keys or strings of musical instruments
examples: The pianist strikes a middle C

results.definition: occupy or take on
hit against; come into sudden contact with
attain
an attack that is intended to seize or inflict damage on or destroy an objective
examples: the strike was scheduled to begin at dawn

results.definition: arrive at after reckoning, deliberating, and weighing

(baseball) a pitch that the batter swings at and misses, or that the batter hits into foul territory, or that the batter does not swing at but the umpire judges to be in the area over home plate and between the batter's knees and shoulders
examples: this pitcher throws more strikes than balls

results.definition: cause to form (an electric arc) between electrodes of an arc lamp
deliver a sharp blow, as with the hand, fist, or weapon
disassemble a temporary structure, such as a tent or a theatrical set
examples: after the show, we'll have to strike the set and pack up

results.definition: indicate (a certain time) by striking
pierce with force
produce by ignition or a blow
